stories.title: Improve your code by separating mechanism from policy
Trying Everything, Even Lettuce, to Save Florida’s Beloved Manatees

stories.text:
Growing up, I was a gifted kid; it wasn't until elite university where I learned about work ethic. I am now a below-average performer at an elite company but making 99th percentile wages.

Anyway... the punchline is that my daughter has always been gifted emotionally (whereas I'm always morose, irrespective of circumstance) but due to some difficulties in preschool, underwent some tests and has an IQ of 102.

Any other parents gone through something similar? This is as much of an emotional matter as anything else, but would love to hear anything anecdotal. Something comforting I found on Wikipedia: "IQ goes from being weakly correlated with genetics for children, to being strongly correlated with genetics for late teens and adults."
stories.title: Ask HN: Any Parents to “Average” Children?
